[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-openapi/src/helpers.rs] [Macro: impl_poem_type!] [Function: raw_element_iter()] [Iterator safety] Can the Box<dyn Iterator> returned by raw_element_iter() cause memory leaks or double-free issues when the iterator is not fully consumed or is dropped unexpectedly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-openapi/src/helpers.rs] [Macro: impl_poem_type!] [Trait: IsObjectType] [Empty trait implementation] Does the empty IsObjectType trait implementation impose any runtime constraints, or can types incorrectly marked as objects cause validation failures in OpenAPI processing? (Low)

(Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-openapi/src/helpers.rs] [Macro: impl_poem_parameter!] [Function: parse_from_multipart()] [Missing field validation] When field is None, does expected_input() provide sufficient error detail, or can attackers probe for optional vs required fields to map API surface area? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-openapi/src/helpers.rs] [Macro: impl_poem_parameter!] [Function: parse_from_multipart()] [Content-Type bypass] Does parse_from_multipart() validate Content-Type headers, or can attackers submit malicious content disguised as legitimate fields to bypass upload validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-openapi/src/helpers.rs] [Macro: impl_poem_type!] [Function: parse_from_json()] [Error information leakage] Do ParseError::custom() messages in parse_from_json() leak sensitive information about internal types, validation logic, or system paths that aids attackers in crafting exploits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-openapi/src/helpers.rs] [Macro: impl_poem_parameter!] [Function: parse_from_parameter()] [Error chaining attack] Can error propagation through map_err() chains expose stack traces or internal error details that reveal validator implementation specifics or cryptographic operation failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-openapi/src/helpers.rs] [Macro: impl_poem_parameter!] [Function: parse_from_multipart()] [Panic on parse error] Does the ? operator properly convert parse errors to ParseError, or can certain FromStr implementations panic instead of returning Err, crashing the API endpoint? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-openapi/src/helpers.rs] [Macro: impl_poem_type!] [Macro expansion] Can macro invocations with specially crafted type names or metadata cause macro expansion errors that inject malicious code or bypass Rust's safety guarantees? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-openapi/src/helpers.rs] [Macro: impl_poem_type!] [Name hygiene] Does stringify!($ty) properly escape special characters in type names, or can types with quotes, backslashes, or Unicode cause code injection during macro expansion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-openapi/src/helpers.rs] [Macro: impl_poem_parameter!] [Trait bound validation] Does the macro enforce that types implement FromStr before allowing parse_from_parameter() usage, or can incorrect invocations cause compilation errors that leak codebase structure? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-openapi/src/helpers.rs] [Macro: impl_poem_type!] [Metadata validation] Are macro metadata parameters ($($key:ident = $value:expr)*) validated at compile time, or can incorrect keys/values cause runtime panics in register()? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-openapi/src/helpers.rs] [Macro: impl_poem_type!] [Registry mutation] Is create_schema atomic and thread-safe when multiple concurrent requests register the same type, or can race conditions cause registry corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-openapi/src/helpers.rs] [Macro: impl_poem_type!] [Schema reference resolution] Does MetaSchemaRef::Reference properly resolve to the registered schema, or can broken references cause API validation failures that reject legitimate transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-openapi/src/helpers.rs] [Macro: impl_poem_parameter!] [Parameter parsing order] Does parse_from_parameter() execute percent_decode before FromStr parsing in the correct order, or can reordering cause validation bypasses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-openapi/src/helpers.rs] [Macro: impl_poem_type!] [Gas amount manipulation] For types representing gas amounts or transaction fees parsed through parse_from_json(), can integer overflow or underflow cause incorrect gas calculations enabling free transactions or DoS? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-openapi/src/helpers.rs] [Macro: impl_poem_type!] [Sequence number bypass] If sequence numbers are parsed as custom types through these macros, can deserialization vulnerabilities enable replay attacks by manipulating or reusing old sequence numbers? (Critical)
